name: Deutschlandstipendium
notes: Applied at your own university. 150 EUR from federal gov + 150 EUR from private donors.

name: Hans-Böckler-Stiftung
notes: Explicitly for Arbeiterkinder. Full BAföG rate + 300 EUR book allowance. Strong mentoring.

name: Rosa-Luxemburg-Stiftung
notes: Affiliated with Die Linke. Values diversity and first-gen backgrounds.

name: Studienstiftung des deutschen Volkes
notes: Largest and most prestigious. Self-application possible since 2010. First-gen students ARE welcome.

name: Stiftung der Deutschen Wirtschaft (sdw)
notes: Studienkolleg program specifically supports first-gen students.

name: Friedrich-Ebert-Stiftung
notes: SPD-affiliated. Values working-class background as a strength.

name: Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung
notes: CDU-affiliated. First-gen status is a plus in selection.

name: Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung
target: Environmental, democratic, and gender equality values
notes: Green-affiliated. Diversity and non-academic backgrounds valued.

name: Cusanuswerk
notes: Catholic church affiliated. Social engagement important.

name: Evangelisches Studienwerk Villigst
notes: Protestant church affiliated. Diversity and first-gen backgrounds welcomed.

name: ArbeiterKind.de Mentoring
notes: Not a financial scholarship but mentoring + scholarship application support. Essential resource.

name: Aufstiegsstipendium (BMBF)
target: Professionals studying for first degree after vocational training
notes: Specifically for people studying after completing an apprenticeship. Perfect for late starters.

name: Avicenna-Studienwerk
target: Muslim students with academic excellence and social engagement
notes: Newest of the 13 Begabtenförderungswerke. Supports Muslim first-gen students.

name: Ernst Ludwig Ehrlich Studienwerk
notes: Supports Jewish students across all denominations.
